subsc: General finance sector,Central government administration,General industry and trade sector,Law and justice,General transportation sector
trustfund:
TF021518-SECONDMENT OF MR. SENGUPTA,TF034977-JORDAN - ECONOMIC REFORM AND
            DEVELOPMENT LOAN III,TF028227-IDF-JORDAN PRIVATIZATION TA PROPOSAL

abstracts.cdata!:
A key objective of the series of
            Economic Reform and Development Loans (ERDLs), of which this
            is the third, is to support Jordan in addressing constraints
            to rapid and sustained growth imposed by the limitations of
            a relatively small domestic market. The loan supports a set
            of trade, privatization, financial sector, and regulatory
            reforms. It further facilitates trade, fosters integration
            with world markets, and reduces administrative obstacles
            that raise the cost of trading activity through streamlining
            customs procedures for exports and the planned conversion of
            the entire Aqaba area into a fully developed free port. It
            supports a broad program of financial sector reform
            initiatives designed to enhance the soundness and efficiency
            of the banking system and promote the development of capital
            market and long-term savings institutions. It improves
            banking competition and supervision and increases the
            efficiency of financial intermediation through modernization
            of the institutional and legislative set-up. It encourages
            long-term savings and promotes development of new financial
            instruments and markets. It facilitates entry and improves
            incentives for domestic and foreign investors. Through
            privatization, it improves opportunities for private sector
            firms, increases competition, and allows the Government to
            concentrate on its core functions. The loan will be
            disbursed in one tranche.
